dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, you know, when you think about the Trumps, historically, it's all about, like, building, right? From Friedrich heading to the Klondike, Fred building his apartment empire, then Donald with the skyscrapers, the White House. It's growth, growth, growth.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, you know, when you think about the Trumps, historically, it's all about, like, building, right? From Friedrich heading to the Klondike, Fred building his apartment empire, then Donald with the skyscrapers, the White House. It's growth, growth, growth.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: They are what nudged Donald Trumps grandfather Friedrich from Germany to New York to the Klondike gold rush; impelled the presidents father, Fred, to build an apartment empire in Brooklyn and Queens; and pushed Donald into Manhattan skyscrapers and, eventually, the White House.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. And, um, when Donald stepped into the Oval Office, you'd think Don Jr. and Eric would just, like, pick up that mantle and run with it, right? Huge ambitions.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. And, um, when Donald stepped into the Oval Office, you'd think Don Jr. and Eric would just, like, pick up that mantle and run with it, right? Huge ambitions.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: When Trump took office and passed the reins to the fourth generation, his sons Eric and Don Jr. had grand ambitions too.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that was the plan! They had these, uh, grand ideas to storm the heartland with two new hotel brands. But, you know, that just completely fell flat earlier this year. Didn't gain any traction at all.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that was the plan! They had these, uh, grand ideas to storm the heartland with two new hotel brands. But, you know, that just completely fell flat earlier this year. Didn't gain any traction at all.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But their planstorm into Americas heartland with two new licensed hotel brandsdied earlier this year after failing to gain traction.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Which is kinda wild, because it forced them into, like, a really un-Trumpian strategy. I mean, their dad pledged not to expand internationally while in office, so they were hamstrung.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is kinda wild, because it forced them into, like, a really un-Trumpian strategy. I mean, their dad pledged not to expand internationally while in office, so they were hamstrung.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: That forced the kids, hamstrung by their fathers pledge not to expand internationally while in office, to pursue a very un-Trumpian strategy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right. And Don Jr. even said, "When politics are over, we'll resume doing what we do best." But for now, they're playing it incredibly safe.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. And Don Jr. even said, When politics are over, we'll resume doing what we do best. But for now, they're playing it incredibly safe.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Added Don Jr.: When politics are over, we will resume doing what we do best, which is building the best and most luxurious properties in the world.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and it's interesting because the president's net worth, uh, has actually stayed flat, even down a bit from when he took office. So you'd think they'd be, like, making risky bets.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and it's interesting because the president's net worth, uh, has actually stayed flat, even down a bit from when he took office. So you'd think they'd be, like, making risky bets.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The president is worth $3.1 billion (good for No. 275 on The Forbes 400), the same as a year ago and down $400 million from when he took office.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But instead, they're just, like, tending to their properties, paying down debt, and, uh, stockpiling cash. It's almost, dare I say, *conservative*?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But instead, they're just, like, tending to their properties, paying down debt, and, uh, stockpiling cash. It's almost, dare I say, conservative?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But Don Jr. and Eric are playing things conservatively, tending to their properties, paying down debt and stockpiling a hoard of cash.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Super conservative! They've sold off a huge chunk, like over $110 million worth of real estate, through more than 100 tiny transactions. Most of it, um, flew under the radar.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Super conservative! They've sold off a huge chunk, like over one hundred ten million dollars worth of real estate, through more than one hundred tiny transactions. Most of it, um, flew under the radar.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Since their fathers inauguration, they have sold off $110 million of the presidents real estate holdingsthrough more than 100 tiny transactions that have mostly flown under the radar.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And some of those sales, though, are a bit eyebrow-raising, aren't they? Like, the Dominican Republic land sale for $3.2 million, which, [interrupts] uh, seems like a pretty clear violation of the "no new foreign deals" pledge.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And some of those sales, though, are a bit eyebrow-raising, aren't they? Like, the Dominican Republic land sale for three point two million dollars, which, uh, seems like a pretty clear violation of the no new foreign deals pledge.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the Dominican Republic, the younger Trumps sold a piece of land in January 2018 for $3.2 million. It was the clearest violation of their fathers pledge to do no new foreign deals while in office.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Totally! Or, you know, selling the Beverly Hills mansion to a company tied to an Indonesian billionaire and business partner. And then there's the Manhattan penthouse to a woman who sells access to Chinese officials.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally! Or, you know, selling the Beverly Hills mansion to a company tied to an Indonesian billionaire and business partner. And then there's the Manhattan penthouse to a woman who sells access to Chinese officials.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: They sold Trumps mansion in Beverly Hills for $13.5 million to a company tied to Indonesian billionaire (and Trump business partner) Hary Tanoesoedibjo. They off-loaded a Manhattan penthouse to a woman who runs a business selling access to Chinese officials.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I mean, if it were anyone else, you probably wouldn't bat an eye. But with Trump in the White House, it just, um, it gets strange. Like the Spring Creek Towers deal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I mean, if it were anyone else, you probably wouldn't bat an eye. But with Trump in the White House, it just, um, it gets strange. Like the Spring Creek Towers deal.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, that one. Yeah, where Secretary Ben Carson had to approve a deal that, like, paid his boss, Trump, an estimated $33 million. That's, uh, awkward.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, that one. Yeah, where Secretary Ben Carson had to approve a deal that, like, paid his boss, Trump, an estimated thirty three million dollars. That's, uh, awkward.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Secretary of Housing & Urban Development Ben Carson had to give his approval to make the deal happen, according to property records. That put Trumps subordinate in the awkward position of having to green-light a transaction that paid his boss an estimated $33 million.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Very. And for all this selling, they're not really reinvesting much, are they? Minor updates to Trump Tower, a San Francisco facelift, but then they're just pouring money into those money-losing European golf resorts.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Very. And for all this selling, they're not really reinvesting much, are they? Minor updates to Trump Tower, a San Francisco facelift, but then they're just pouring money into those money-losing European golf resorts.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For all this selling, the Trumps have done very little reinvesting. Trump Tower got minor updates, a five-story San Francisco office building got a face-lift and the Trumps keep stuffing cash into their money-losing European golf resorts.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: The only big new purchase was, like, an $18.5 million mansion next to Mar-a-Lago, but, uh, that was from their aunt, Maryanne Trump Barry. So, not exactly expanding the empire.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The only big new purchase was, like, an eighteen point five million dollar mansion next to Mar-a-Lago, but, uh, that was from their aunt, Maryanne Trump Barry. So, not exactly expanding the empire.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But theyve really made only one new purchase, buying an $18.5 million mansion next to Mar-a-Lagofrom their aunt, Maryanne Trump Barry.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It really makes you wonder. I mean, they've been chipping away at debt, too. Paid down an estimated $60 million since the inauguration. Like, $19 million in New York liabilities alone.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really makes you wonder. I mean, they've been chipping away at debt, too. Paid down an estimated sixty million dollars since the inauguration. Like, nineteen million dollars in New York liabilities alone.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Instead, the Trump children have been chipping away at the debt that helped build their fathers empire, quietly paying down an estimated $60 million since the inauguration. In New York, they wiped out roughly $19 million of liabilities at 40 Wall Street, 6 East 57th Street and 502 Park Avenue.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and even eight million dollars of debt on a San Francisco skyscraper. So, it's not about big new projects, it's about, like, shoring up the existing foundation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and even eight million dollars of debt on a San Francisco skyscraper. So, it's not about big new projects, it's about, like, shoring up the existing foundation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In San Francisco, where the president owns 30% of a skyscraper alongside billionaire Steven Roths Vornado Realty Trust, Trumps kids have erased $8 million of his debt.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So are they, you know, setting themselves up for a post-presidency spending spree, or is this just the new normal for the Trump Organization?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So are they, you know, setting themselves up for a post-presidency spending spree, or is this just the new normal for the Trump Organization?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Good question. Maybe they're just, uh, stockpiling cash to, like, resume building 'the best and most luxurious properties' when the political noise dies down.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Good question. Maybe they're just, uh, stockpiling cash to, like, resume building the best and most luxurious properties when the political noise dies down.
